newsitem.title: UK: EBRD lends $42 mln to build supermarkets in Moscow.
newsitem.headline: EBRD lends $42 mln to build supermarkets in Moscow.

text.p: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) has provided Russia's Alfa Consortium with $42 million to finance the opening of new supermarkets, the EBRD said in a statement.
The package includes a $17.5 million loan, provided by a syndicate of four international banks, it said.
The borrower is Zao Perekrestok, owned by Alfa Eco, part of the Alfa Consortium of companies, one of the largest new industrial-financial conglomerates in Russia, it said.

"The EBRD's loan to Perekrestok is an important step for the Alfa Consortium as it reflects our increasing ability to access international sources of capital which will have a positive impact on our future growth," said Mikhail Fridman, Chairman of the Alfa Consortium.
The EBRD loan will enable Perekrestok to open six supermarkets in the next 18 months in districts of Moscow, in addition to the five it already operates.
The consortium of banks includes Nederlandse Financierings-Maatschappij voor Ontwikkelingslanden, Rabobank, Bank Austria and Bank Przemyslowo-Handlowy, the statement said.
